snippet: The dispute in the Catholic Church over a nun’s book raises questions that are always lurking for Protestants, Jews and Muslims as well.
abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column observes that the dispute in the Catholic Church over the book Just Love: A Framework for Christian Sexual Ethics, written by Sister Margaret Farley, raises for each religion the question of who should control central religious texts.
lead_paragraph: The dispute in the Catholic Church over a nun’s book raises questions that are always lurking for Protestants, Jews and Muslims as well.
